Class Invoice

java.lang.Object
  Invoice

public class Invoice
extends Object

This class simulates an Invoice (receipt) at a store for Products purchased by a customer. Each invoice has collection of LineItems. Collection is represented by an array of LineItem objects.

Version:
1 - April 2014
Author:
Aparna Mahadev

Constructor Detail

Invoice

public Invoice()
Constructor for objects of class Invoice. Initializes the collection to hold 10 LineItems objects. Initializes count to 0.

Returns:
the amount currently owed by the customer

print

public void print()
Prints the invoice on the screen

update

public void update(String name,
                   int q)
updates the quantity for a line item. This method searches through the collection of LineItems and finds the one that has the same name as the parameter. It then sets the quantity of that product to the parameter value. If the quantity is 0, the LineItem is removed from the collection and count is adjusted accordingly (this is achieved by calling a private method removeFromInvoice that takes the paramter name). If there is no LineItem with a name that matches the parameter name, this method has no effect.

Parameters:
name - Name of the Product
q - new value for quantity
